name: Chia Seed Chips
author: Robynowitz
summary: While waiting for a batch of crackers to finish baking, I was playing with the remaining dough and forming bite-size rounds and though they would make great chips (and they do -- they're amazing!). These chips should keep for about a week if stored properly.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix flour, chia seeds, 1 1/2 teaspoons seasoned salt, and sea salt in a bowl; stir in water until dough is completely combined
Form dough into thin bite-size rounds and arrange on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until crisp, about 15 minutes
Cool completely and store in an airtight container or resealable bag
